Master Answer:
The hepatitis A vaccine is routinely given as a series of two doses.  Booster doses of the hepatitis A vaccine are not recommended at this time.  If you are traveling, it is recommended that you follow up with your health care provider or local travel clinic for travel vaccine recommendations. 
You can find more information on the hepatitis A vaccine in the HealthLinkBC File: Hepatitis A Vaccine. 
- Immunization Nurse
Master Question: My children being vaccinated for Hepatitis A prior to a trip to Mexico in July. husband and I have both been vaccinated preivously, around 15 years ago - are we still covered?
Master Question variation 0: are you still covered when you vaccinate children with hep a
Master Question variation 1: when did we get vaccinated for hepatitis
